Presence or execution of known remote ac.Action: Monitor Windows Event ID 4688 logs for process creation events containing known remote access tool executable names or paths. Use frequency analysis to identify rare process creations across endpoints/servers. Correlate with other suspicious activities detected on the host.

Network connections involving unusual tr.Data: Zeek conn.log, Zeek dce_rpc.log, Zeek rdp.log, Zeek ssh.log
Network connections involving unusual tr.Action: Analyze Zeek conn.log for connections on common remote access ports (e.g., RDP 3389, VNC 5900-5902, SSH 22) with asymmetric data flow (e.g., significantly more data sent than received by the 'server' side). Use statistical analysis on byte counts (orig_bytes vs resp_bytes) to identify deviations from normal RDP/VNC/SSH session profiles. Examine application layer logs (Zeek dce_rpc.log, rdp.log, ssh.log) for unusual protocol behavior.
